data.title: Chinese EV companies set to shine at Thailand expo
data.description: Chinese electric vehicle brands are among the most anticipated participants at the 41st Bangkok International Motor Expo, which kicks off on Friday.

data.title: Thailand, US to resume direct flights
data.description: Thailand and the United States are expected to resume direct flights in February of next year when the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) of the US Department of Transportation upgrades Thai aviation safety from Category 2 to Category 1, according to Deputy Prime Minister and Transport Minister Suriya Jungrungreangkit.

data.title: A question of leadership
data.description: The prospect of the next polls in 2027 being run under the current constitution shouldn

data.title: Formaldehyde found in e-cig samples, dept says
data.description: The Department of Disease Control (DDC) has warned that formaldehyde was found in samples of e-cigarette liquids sold illegally in Thailand and that the aerosol of the chemical can cause cancer.

data.title: BMA postpones plan to close major road
data.description: The Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) has postponed plans to close the elevated road on Rama IX from Dec 2 this year until further notice.

data.title: Fast progress in Chiang Rai rail project
data.description: The construction of a new railway project with four tunnels designed to withstand the impact of natural disasters in Chiang Rai has progressed by 20%, said the Department of Rail Transport

data.title: There's plenty for Thai star Jeeno to smile about
data.description: It has been both a triumphant and lucrative week for Thailand

data.title: PM urges people not to protest over sea border row
data.description: The government yesterday urged people not to take to the streets over the controversial 2001 Thailand-Cambodia memorandum of understanding (MoU) on joint development in the Gulf of Thailand, saying Thailand would not lose an inch of its territory to Cambodia.

data.title: Thai shuttlers stay on course in Lucknow
data.description: Mixed doubles pair Dechapol Puavaranukroh and Supissara Paewsampran and women

data.title: Port progress, Kirins revive ACL 2 hopes
data.description: Thai League 1 giants Port sealed progression to the knockout stage of the AFC Champions League Two after a 2-2 draw with Persib Bandung in Group F on Thursday night at BG Stadium.

data.title: B19bn to fix two northern provinces
data.description: The government has approved 19 billion baht to fix infrastructure and utilities in Chiang Mai and Chiang Rai following the recent heavy floods, government spokesman Jirayu Houngsub said.

data.title: Tourism and private consumption boost Thailand’s economy: BOT
data.description: Government’s cash handout scheme has contributed to rising consumption

data.title: Picket over land loss decrees
data.description: About 5,000 members of the assembly of the people living in community forests stormed Chiang Mai City Hall on Friday, demanding the government stop the implementation of the royal decrees on conserving and protecting natural resources in national parks and wildlife reserves as the laws will have a severe impact on the way of life of their communities.

data.title: Govt revs up flood aid in South
data.description: The government is stepping up efforts to help flood victims in several provinces in the South as more than 240,000 households were hit by severe flooding triggered by days of heavy rainfall.

data.title: Macron hails Notre-Dame restoration
data.description: PARIS - French President Emmanuel Macron on Friday praised the more than 1,000 artisans who helped rebuild  Notre-Dame  Cathedral in what he called “the project of the century”, five-and-a-half years after fire gutted the Gothic masterpiece.

data.title: British lawmakers vote to legalise assisted dying
data.description: LONDON - Britain’s parliament has voted in favour of a new bill to legalise  assisted dying , paving the way for months of further debate on an issue that has divided the country and raised questions about the standard of palliative care.

data.title: 20-baht transit fare extended for 2025
data.description: The cabinet has approved a budget of 400 million baht to support the extension of the  20-baht flat fare  for the Red and Purple  electric train  lines for another year.

data.title: Korean influencer targeted for lese-majeste
data.description: A royalist group has asked the police to investigate whether a Korean internet  influencer  with 1 million  TikTok  followers has violated Thailand’s  lese-majeste  law.

data.title: 17 loan sharks nabbed in Pattaya
data.description: PATTAYA - Seventeen Chinese nationals have been arrested in two houses in Pattaya on charges of operating an illegal loan business, police say.

data.title: Blue by Alain Ducasse Celebrates Fifth Consecutive Year with Michelin
data.description: Bangkok, November 2024 – Blue by Alain Ducasse, Bangkok

data.title: Over 2,500 accidents happened on Rama II Road between 2018 and 2023
data.description: Large-scale projects aimed at reducing traffic congestion have not gone smoothly

data.title: Smart Living Project aims to make Sikhio in Korat a model smart city
data.description: Focus on leveraging technology to improve municipal management, public services and societal engagement

data.title: British lawmakers open emotional debate on assisted dying
data.description: LONDON - British lawmakers were deciding on Friday whether to support assisted dying after an impassioned debate over a bill that has sparked a national conversation over dignity in death and end-of-life care.

data.title: Thais shift to renting as property market booms in tourist cities
data.description: Thailand’s real estate market is seeing a shift as more people opt for renting due to economic challenges, high household debts and rising interest rates

data.title: Guru's Weekly Buzz: Nov 29-Dec 5
data.description: Guru By Bangkok Post

data.title: Thailand ‘forcibly’ deports six Cambodian activists
data.description: Thai authorities have “forcibly” returned six  Cambodian  political opposition  activists  and a young child, putting them at risk of unfair trials and mistreatment in Cambodia,  Human Rights Watch  (HRW) said on Friday.

data.title: Rama II Road contractor faces ban after 6 killed in accident
data.description: A two- to four-year ban is likely to be imposed on the contractor after six people were killed in a work-related accident, the government said on Friday.

data.title: Reflect on a Decade with Sundae Kids
data.description: River City Bangkok has proudly unveiled “Sundae Kids: 10 Years of Lost and Found,” a heartfelt anniversary exhibition celebrating a decade of the renowned duo’s artistic evolution. Launched on November 27, 2024, this immersive showcase invites visitors to reflect on their own journeys, exploring profound questions such as:

data.title: Facebook IRL comes to Bangkok to empower digital creators
data.description: The unique initiative open to all digital creators promises to be an immersive experience

data.title: Govt raises elderly allowance, adjusts money for children, disabled
data.description: The cabinet agreed on Friday to raise the monthly allowance for senior citizens and adjust the allowances for children and the disabled.

data.title: Thailand pioneering the use of recycled plastic for food packaging
data.description: Innovation by state agricultural research agency aims to cut plastic pollution

data.title: Experience Taiwan’s Culinary Treasures at TAIWAN SELECT Lounge
data.description: The TAIWAN SELECT LOUNGE at Taiwan Expo 2024, hosted by Taiwan’s Ministry of Economic Affairs (MOEA), showcases Taiwan’s rich culinary heritage and regional flavours. Located at Booth No. 547 in Hall 5 of the Queen Sirikit National Convention Centre, the Lounge features a selection of specialities from Taiwan’s diverse regions, offering visitors an opportunity to explore the country’s culture through cherished foods such as pineapple cakes, oolong tea, mochi, and more.

data.title: Thai Wah and Fuji Nihon Unite for Agri-Food Innovation
data.description: Thai Wah Public Company Limited (TWPC), a leader in the agri-food industry, has partnered with Japan’s Fuji Nihon Corporation (FNC) to form a strategic joint venture. This collaboration will focus on the manufacturing, sales, and distribution of tapioca starch and related products, cementing their positions as innovators in the food ingredients sector.

data.title: Pattani province struggles with heavy flooding as rains persist
data.description: Rising waters force three hospitals to stop operations, as the Thai Meteorological Department warns heavy rains will continue

data.title: Cabinet greenlights THB20 train fare until November 2025
data.description: Move will cost the government THB300 billion in lost revenue

data.title: Southern flooding disrupts train, bus services
data.description: The railway agency has cancelled some trains servicing the southernmost areas, while bus operators cannot go beyond Hat Yai district in Songkhla until further notice due to heavy rain inundating the tracks and roads.

data.title: Discover Global Flavours at The Mall Food Expo
data.description: The Mall Lifestore, in collaboration with the Ministry of Commerce, the Rice Department, the Ministry of Agriculture and Cooperatives, Thai Life Insurance Public Company Limited, and Thai Namthip Corporation Limited, presents “The Mall Lifestore Food Expo” under the theme “The Rice Journey.” This unique event showcases international culinary creations using rice varieties from around the world, complemented by special dishes crafted by Thailand’s top chefs and a rice innovation exhibition by the Rice Department.
